info.headline: Heat Advisory issued September 07 at 2:27PM PDT until September 07 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 11 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 103 this afternoon. For the second Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 107 expected with lows in the mid 60`s. * WHERE...In California, Central Siskiyou County and South Central Siskiyou County. In Oregon, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from 11 AM Friday to 11 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur for those without effective cooling or adequate hydration. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Smoke from new fires could impact the high temperature forecast this weekend. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances.
